Jean Lacy (amụrụ n'afọ 1932 na Washington, D.C.) bụ ónyé America na-ahụ màkà agụmakwụkwọ na ihe ngosi nka na ónyé na-ese ihe nkírí nke na-arụ ọrụ na mgbasa ozi na collage.

Ọ bụ ónyé Africa America, ma kwenyere na ezinụlọ ya sitere na ndị Afrịka na Jamestown Colony. Ọrụ ya sitere n'ike mmụọ nsọ nke akụkọ ifo na akụkọ okpukpe, Civil Rights Movement, na omenala ndị Africa America
Site na 1975-77 ọ nọ n'ọkwa ónyé nlekọta nke agụmakwụkwọ na ngosi na Museum of African-American Life and Culture na Dallas, Texas
Site na 1977-88 ọ rụrụ ọrụ dị ka ónyé nduzi nke African American Cultural Heritage Center nke Dallas Independent School District.

N'afọ 2009, Lacy nwèrè ihe ngosi onwe ya, Divine Kinship: Ancient Forms and Social Commentary, the Art of Jean Lacy, na Tyler Museum of Art. A gụnyere ọrụ ya na ihe ngosi otu gụnyere Black Artists / South na Huntsville Museum of Art na Alabama; National Urban League Expo na Houston, TX, na ihe ngosi African American Artists of Dallas na Southern Methodist University Gallery.
Ọrụ Lacy dị na nchịkọta nke Dallas Museum of Art, na Museum of Fine Arts, Houston.
E nyèrè Lacy ọrụ ịmepụta windo enyo iji sọpụrụ Rosa Parks na Sanctuary of St
Luke's United Methodist Church na Dallas, TX
Ọ natawokwa ọrụ màkà windo enyo na Houston.
N'afọ 1995, Lacy natara Women's Caucus for Art Lifetime Achievement Award.
